topic.name: Dance, Movement & Choreography
topic.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
topic.description: 13-year academic progression (K-12) for Dance, Movement & Choreography in Fine Arts

objectives.objective_text: Identify a beginning and ending pose.
Identify a formation change.
Identify left and right.
Identify core muscles (tummy).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Elements of Dance (space, time, energy, body)
objectives.objective_text: Identify fast and slow movement.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Historical Dance Forms (ballet, folk, period dances)
objectives.objective_text: Identify a ballerina.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Historical Dance Forms (ballet, folk, period dances)
objectives.objective_text: Identify the Waltz (1-2-3).
Identify David dancing for the Lord.
Identify joy in movement.
Recall to be careful not to bump others.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Elements of Dance (space, time, energy, body)
objectives.objective_text: Recall that dance is moving to music.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Elements of Dance (space, time, energy, body)
objectives.objective_text: Observe dancers staying in their own space.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Historical Dance Forms (ballet, folk, period dances)
objectives.objective_text: Recall that people danced long ago.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Historical Dance Forms (ballet, folk, period dances)
objectives.objective_text: Observe folk dances from other lands.
Recall that God made our bodies.
Observe respectful movement.
Make up a dance.
Repeat a move 4 times.
Follow the leader.
Summarize how to count to 8 in dance.
Explain Unison (everyone together) vs. Canon (ripple).
Explain symmetry vs. asymmetry in grouping.
Defend choreography as 'writing with the body'.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Historical Dance Forms (ballet, folk, period dances)
objectives.objective_text: Explain the 5 basic positions of Ballet (intro).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Historical Dance Forms (ballet, folk, period dances)
objectives.objective_text: Perform a simple Minuet or Pavane.
Balance on one foot.
Stretch tall and small.
Summarize the importance of warming up.
Explain Flexibility and Strength.
Coordinate arm and leg movements.
Explain injury prevention.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Elements of Dance (space, time, energy, body)
objectives.objective_text: Move high (tiptoes) and low (crawling).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Elements of Dance (space, time, energy, body)
objectives.objective_text: Summarize the elements: Space, Time, Force.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Elements of Dance (space, time, energy, body)
objectives.objective_text: Explain the difference between sharp and smooth movement.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Elements of Dance (space, time, energy, body)
objectives.objective_text: Explain 'Isolation' of body parts.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Elements of Dance (space, time, energy, body)
objectives.objective_text: Defend the body as a vehicle for expression.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Historical Dance Forms (ballet, folk, period dances)
objectives.objective_text: Dance in a circle holding hands.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Historical Dance Forms (ballet, folk, period dances)
objectives.objective_text: Summarize the origins of a Square Dance.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Historical Dance Forms (ballet, folk, period dances)
objectives.objective_text: Explain the Polka or Contra dance structure.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Historical Dance Forms (ballet, folk, period dances)
objectives.objective_text: Defend the preservation of folk traditions.
Identify dancing with bare feet.
Identify parallel vs. turned out feet.
Lift hands to praise God.
Summarize the difference between showing off and worshipping.
Explain the use of banners or flags (optional).
Process into a room with dignity.
Explain the history of liturgical dance.
Defend the physical expression of spiritual truth.
Analyze the use of levels and pathways.
Interpret a musical phrase into movement.
Connect a movement motif to a theme.
Analyze body alignment (ears over shoulders over hips).
Interpret the sensation of 'grounding'.
Connect core strength to balance.
Defend the stewardship of physical health.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Elements of Dance (space, time, energy, body)
objectives.objective_text: Compare locomotor (traveling) vs. non-locomotor movement.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Elements of Dance (space, time, energy, body)
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the use of negative space in dance.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Elements of Dance (space, time, energy, body)
objectives.objective_text: Interpret rhythm and syncopation in movement.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Elements of Dance (space, time, energy, body)
objectives.objective_text: Connect breath to flow.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Historical Dance Forms (ballet, folk, period dances)
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the posture required for different historical periods.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Historical Dance Forms (ballet, folk, period dances)
objectives.objective_text: Interpret the social function of dance (courtship, community).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Historical Dance Forms (ballet, folk, period dances)
objectives.objective_text: Connect the Swing era to Jazz music.
Analyze the Hebrew words for praise involving movement.
Interpret the body as a living sacrifice.
Connect posture (kneeling, standing) to heart attitude.
Evaluate somatic practices (e.g., Alexander Technique basics).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Elements of Dance (space, time, energy, body)
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the kinetic logic of a sequence.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Historical Dance Forms (ballet, folk, period dances)
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the influence of court dance on ballet technique.
Move freely without rules.
Roll on the floor.
Express a feeling through dance.
Summarize how Modern dance broke the rules of Ballet.
Explain Contract and Release (Graham).
Improvise movement to a word.
Explain 'Contact Improvisation' (sharing weight).
Defend the rejection of rigidity in art.
Evaluate the appropriateness of dance in corporate worship.
Create a dance pattern (ABA).
Construct a complete choreographed piece.
Synthesize musicality and spatial design.
Construct a personal conditioning plan.
Synthesize anatomical knowledge with movement efficiency.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Elements of Dance (space, time, energy, body)
objectives.objective_text: Create a shape with the body.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Elements of Dance (space, time, energy, body)
objectives.objective_text: Construct a movement phrase using Laban Efforts.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Elements of Dance (space, time, energy, body)
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize multiple elements to convey an abstract idea.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Historical Dance Forms (ballet, folk, period dances)
objectives.objective_text: Construct a period-accurate dance for a play.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Historical Dance Forms (ballet, folk, period dances)
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize historical research with performance style.
Analyze the use of gravity (fall and recovery).
Interpret abstract movement.
Connect the spine's flexibility to modern technique.
Construct a theology of the body in motion.
Synthesize modesty and expressiveness.
Evaluate the visual impact of group architecture.
Evaluate the fusion of styles in modern dance.
Construct a contemporary combination.
Synthesize athleticism and artistry.
